required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Evaluation of Modified Adhesives With Dexcom G6 Sensor
clinical_study.official_title: Evaluation of Modified Adhesives With Dexcom G6 Sensor

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of the study is to collect and compare information on the performance of CGM adhesives in adults.

primary_outcome.measure: Adhesiveness and survivability of the adhesives
primary_outcome.description: Number of adhesives that survive on the body during wear period

secondary_outcome.description: Proportion of participants who self-report skin irritation during wear period.

secondary_outcome.measure: Occurrence of adverse events with the adhesives
secondary_outcome.description: Highest Draize scale score for adhesive erythema, and edema during wear period. Recorded medical adhesive-related skin injuries (MARSI) and severity during wear period.

secondary_outcome.measure: Assess user preference or acceptance of the adhesives worn during the study
secondary_outcome.description: Final day post-study satisfaction questionnaire (for each adhesive) will be given a score by taking the mean response on the scale 1-5. Satisfaction scores will be tabulated by adhesive.

study_pop.textblock: Potential study participants will be identified via diabetes patient website and/or virtual registry.
